content: viking socks by lykkefanten from http //www lykkeogloekker blogspot com feel free to enjoy them but please credit me for the design sizes s m/l suggestions for adaptations in size given note on sizing if desired you can widen your sock by working an extra repeat or several of ribbing in the side just keep front and back the same you can also lengthen the toe if necessary by working more repeats of round 1 and 2 before the rounds of solely decreasing materials 100 grams of sock yarn the models shown are knitted in filo arwetta sock yarn needles 3mm dpns or 2 5mm if you want a smaller size note the cables on the two socks are not exactly alike they are mirror versions of each other this means that for one sock you should use diagrams a1 and a2 and for the other sock you should use diagrams b1 and b2 to obtain symmetry abbreviations see the diagrams for visualizations 2/2lc place 2 sts on cn to front k2 k2 on cn 2/2rc place 2 sts on cn to the back k2 k2 on cn 2/1plc place 2 sts on cn to the front p1 k2 on cn 1/2prc place 1 sts on cn to the back k2 p1 on cn 2/2plc place 2 sts on cn to the front p2 k2 on cn 2/2prc place 2 sts on cn to the back k2 p2 on cn 1 k knit p purl k2to knit two together p2to purl two together ssk slip 2 stitches individually to right needle knitwise slip left needle through front of stitches and k2to through back loops sl slip sts - stitches pattern cast on 64 72 sts on size 3mm dpns and knit in ribbing k2 p2 for 19 rounds mark the start of the round now knit a preparation round where you move the needles such that you have 20 20 sts on the back needle with the marker between sts 12 and 13 on this needle 8 12 sts on each side needle and 28 28 sts on the front needle note that the start of the pattern is at the 1st sts on the back needle thus 12 sts to the right of the real start on the back needle knit the small viking cable diagram a2 or b2 and on the front knit the big viking cable diagram a1 or b1 start with line a in the pattern and then repeat lines 1 to 16 in a1 or b1 likewise start with line a at the back and repeat line 1 to 8 in a2 or b2 knit 3 repeats of the big viking cable 6 repeats of the small viking cable and knit round 1 and 2 once more but stopping on the last round 3 sts before the back needle in a k2 heel now the heel is prepared make 1 sts by picking up a sts from between the k2 and knitting it turned this
